conclusion: To determine how much the magnetic flux passing through the coil changes as the coil rotates 60° around the z-axis.
The coil is initially in the plane perpendicular to the x-axis.
The magnetic induction intensity B = 0.1 T.
The area of the coil S = 0.4 m².

premise: Since the plane of the coil is perpendicular to the magnetic field.
conclusion: The magnetic flux Φ₁ = B × S = 0.1 × 0.4 = 0.04 Wb.
The coil is rotated 60° around the z-axis.

premise: The angle between the normal to the coil and the magnetic field direction is 60°.
conclusion: The magnetic flux through the coil in this position is Φ₂ = B × S × cos(60°).

premise: The change in magnetic flux is ΔΦ = Φ₁ - Φ₂.

conclusion: The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is 0.02 Wb.
